conbody.p: This section describes the dimensioning of PCI passthrough (PCI-PT) devices to provide direct I/O to a guest VM, bypassing the virtual switch. PCI-PT allows guests to have exclusive access to PCI devices on the host and is mapped up directly into the guest; therefore the full capabilities of a NIC are available for the guest VM. The limitations of this configuration is that advanced features of AVS are not applied to traffic that has direct communication with the guest VM, such as QoS and ACLs. In addition, the PCI-PT port is not directly integrated with other tenant network such as virtual routers and DHCP services.
